title: 106_s786
content: The Act titled "Social Security Family Protection Act" amends the Social Security Act to address the computation and payment of the last monthly insurance benefit terminated by death. The Social Security Family Protection Act amends the Social Security Act to address the computation and payment of the last monthly insurance benefit terminated by death. The amount of the benefit paid in the event of death within the first 15 days of a month is reduced to 50 percent, rounded down to the nearest dollar. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. The Social Security Family Protection Act amends the Social Security Act to reduce the last monthly insurance benefit terminated by death to 50 percent if the individual dies within the first 15 days of a month. This adjustment is made after all other benefit adjustments have been applied. This adjustment is made after all other benefit adjustments have been applied. The payment under this section is made in accordance with section 204(d). The Social Security Family Protection Act amends sections related to old-age and wife's insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. It includes changes to the calculation and termination of benefits upon death. The Social Security Act is amended to change husband's insurance benefits, including the redesignation of subparagraphs and conforming amendments. The Social Security Act is amended to modify child's and widow's insurance benefits by changing certain provisions related to the ending of benefits upon death or remarriage. The Social Security Act is amended to modify insurance benefits for widowers, mothers, fathers, and parents by changing provisions related to the ending of benefits upon death or remarriage. Specifically, amendments are made to sections regarding parent's insurance benefits and disability insurance benefits to adjust the ending of benefits in case of death or marriage. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to insurance benefits for widowers, mothers, fathers, and parents. This involves modifying provisions related to the ending of benefits upon death or remarriage, such as adjusting benefits for uninsured individuals at age 72 and exempting certain individuals from the maximum benefit cap. Exemption from maximum benefit cap for certain individuals receiving benefits under specific sections. Effective date for amendments made by the Act is 180 days after enactment, applicable to deaths occurring after that date.
